sen.j: 柿の葉寿司（かきのはずし）は、奈良県・和歌山県、および石川県の郷土料理。
sen.e: Kakinoha-zushi is a local dish of Nara Prefecture, Wakayama Prefecture, and Ishikawa Prefecture.
Kakinoha-zushi is a local dish of Nara Prefecture, Wakayama Prefecture, and Ishikawa Prefecture.
Kakinoha-zushi is a local dish of Nara Prefecture, Wakayama Prefecture, and Ishikawa Prefecture.

sen.j: 奈良県・和歌山県と石川県では作り方・形状が異なる。
sen.e: How it is made and its shapes differ among Nara Prefecture, Wakayama Prefecture, and Ishikawa Prefecture.
How it is made and its shapes differ among Nara Prefecture, Wakayama Prefecture, and Ishikawa Prefecture.
How it is made and its shapes differ among Nara Prefecture, Wakayama Prefecture, and Ishikawa Prefecture.
Nara Prefecture and Wakayama Prefecture
Nara Prefecture and Wakayama Prefecture
Nara Prefecture and Wakayama Prefecture

sen.j: 一口大の酢飯にサバやサケなどの切り身と合わせ、カキノキの葉で包んで押しをかけたすし。
sen.e: Sliced mackerel or salmon is added to the bite sized vinegar rice, and is pressed by wrapping persimmon leaves.
Sliced mackerel or salmon is added to bite-sized vinegar rice, and it is wrapped with persimmon leaves and pressed.
Sliced mackerel or salmon is added to bite-sized vinegar rice, and it is wrapped with persimmon leaves and pressed.

sen.j: 食べるに当たって柿の葉は剥がして食べる。
sen.e: Persimmon leaves are peeled off when eating.
Persimmon leaves are peeled off when eating.
Persimmon leaves are peeled off when eating.

sen.j: 柿の葉は通常食べない。
sen.e: Normally, persimmon leaves are not eaten.
Normally, persimmon leaves are not eaten.
Normally, persimmon leaves are not eaten.

sen.j: 場所によっては、柿の葉を巻く前に昆布を巻いてから柿の葉を巻くところもある（らしい）。
sen.e: In some places, (it is said that) konbu (a kind of kelp used for Japanese soup stock) is wrapped around before wrapping with persimmon leaves.
In some places, (it is said that) the vinegar rice is wrapped with konbu (a kind of kelp used for Japanese soup stock) before wrapped with persimmon leaves.
In some places, (it is said that) the vinegar rice is wrapped with konbu (a kind of kelp used for Japanese soup stock) before wrapped with persimmon leaves.

sen.j: 柿の葉には殺菌効果があるといわれており、包むことにより（季節などにもよるが）数日程度の保存に適するようになる。
sen.e: Persimmon leaves are said to have antibacterial effects, and by wrapping with them, sushi may be (depending on seasons) preserved for about a few days.
Persimmon leaves are said to have antibacterial effects, and by wrapping with them, sushi can be (depending on seasons) preserved for about a few days.
Persimmon leaves are said to have antibacterial effects, and by wrapping with them, sushi can be (depending on seasons) preserved for about a few days.

sen.j: 柿の葉は、やわらかくするため、あるいは殺菌効果を高めるため、塩漬けにする場合がある。
sen.e: Persimmon leaves are pickled in salt to soften the leaves or to heighten its antibacterial effects.
Persimmon leaves are pickled in salt to soften the leaves or to heighten its antibacterial effects.
Persimmon leaves are pickled in salt to soften the leaves or to heighten its antibacterial effects.

sen.j: なお、和歌山県では和歌山県推薦優良土産品に指定されている。
sen.e: Further, it is designated as the outstanding souvenir recommended by Wakayama Prefecture.
Further, it is designated as the outstanding souvenir recommended by Wakayama Prefecture.
Further, it is designated as the outstanding souvenir recommended by Wakayama Prefecture.

sen.j: 奈良県、和歌山県内のJR線、近鉄線の主要駅（近鉄の場合は主に特急停車駅）で販売されている。
sen.e: They are sold in the major stations (in the case of Kintetsu line, mainly stations that express trains makes a stop) of JR lines and Kintetsu line in Nara Prefecture and Wakayama Prefecture.

It is sold in the major stations of JR lines and the Kintetsu line in Nara Prefecture and Wakayama Prefecture (in the case of the Kintetsu line, it is sold mainly stations at which the limited express stop).
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: It is sold in the major stations of JR lines and the Kintetsu line in Nara Prefecture and Wakayama Prefecture (in the case of the Kintetsu line, it is sold mainly stations at which the limited express stop).

sen.j: また近鉄特急の車内販売でも発売されていた
sen.e: Also, they were sold inside the Kintetsu Limited Express trains.
It had been sold in the limited express of the Kintetsu line.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: It had been sold in the limited express of the Kintetsu line.
Ishikawa Prefecture
Ishikawa Prefecture
Ishikawa Prefecture

sen.j: 広げた柿の葉の上に鯖・鮭・ブリ・鯛などのネタ、寿司飯の順に載せ、表面にサクラエビ、青藻などを散らし、桶に重ねて重しを乗せて1日～数日おいてから食べる。
sen.e: On a outspread persimmon leaf, in order of ingredients such as mackerel, salmon, Japanese amberjack, and sea breams, and then vinegar rice are placed, and sakuraebi (a small (pink) shrimp) and seaweed are sprinkled on the surface, and eaten after a day to a couple of days of pressing with weights in a wooden bucket.

On an unfolded persimmon leaf is put on neta (sliced fish for sushi) including mackerel, salmon, yellowtail and bream; the next, vinegar rice is put on neta; then sakura-ebi (small pink shrimp) and seaweed are sprinkled over the rice, and it is put in a container; after the container filled with them, some weight is put on them and they are preserved for a day to a couple of days; after that they can be eaten.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択、文法ミスがあります。この場合地方や人によってどんな容器のことも桶と言ったりしますので箱の意味にもボールの意味にも取れるcontainerにします。
sen.e: On an unfolded persimmon leaf is put on neta (sliced fish for sushi) including mackerel, salmon, yellowtail and bream; the next, vinegar rice is put on neta; then sakura-ebi (small pink shrimp) and seaweed are sprinkled over the rice, and it is put in a container; after the container filled with them, some weight is put on them and they are preserved for a day to a couple of days; after that they can be eaten.

sen.j: 柿の葉は通常食べない。
sen.e: Normally, persimmon leaves are not eaten.
Normally, persimmon leaves are not eaten.
Normally, persimmon leaves are not eaten.

sen.j: 家庭では主に夏・秋の祭りの時期に作られることが多い。
sen.e: They are made at homes in the times of festivals during summer and autumn.
They are made at homes in the times of festivals during summer and autumn.
They are made at homes in the times of festivals during summer and autumn.
